fields.name: BALASSA Betsek Édes Szamorodni "Kvarc" 2017
fields.description: 2017 was an exceptional sweet wine year. The Furmint and Hárslevelű bunches botrytize the nicest when botrytis hits them in complete ripeness. “It was spontaneously fermented in two Trust barrels, one of 300 litres and one of 225 litres, where it was also aged for more than a year. I like Szamorodni when it’s muscly, when it can stand up to an aszú with its thickness and power. This is like that: 200 grams of residual sugar, vibrant acidity, creaminess and powerful Betsek fruitiness.” István Balassa.

fields.name: BÖJT Kékfrankos 2017
fields.description: Gergő Böjt’s big wine from one of the best recent vintages. It underwent controlled fermentation in tanks, then a few months after the harvest, it continued ageing in the winery’s colourful barrels, mainly in second- and third-fill oak. It’s full of spices, lively red and black fruits, with a long, mineral, linear palate and great acidity.

fields.name: CSANÁDI Chardonnay 2020
fields.description: The Csanádi family started its work in the Hajós-Baja wine region 20 years ago, between the villages of Hajós and Császártöltés. The consistency of the wine region and winemaking makes it possible for the wines from local and international varieties to be made to the same quality level and style every vintage. The living proof of the latter, the Chardonnay, was made in tanks after hand sorting, in order to present the lighter version of the variety.

fields.name: ETYEKI KÚRIA Rosé 2019
fields.description: It’s crispy and sweet like cherries picked freshly from the tree. Rosé has a serious tradition at the Kúria, yet based on our tasting, this is the nicest vintage so far. The red fruits come from the Merlot, the exciting spices from the Kékfrankos, the elegant flavours of rosehip and the cherry from the Pinot Noir. It’s a long, round rosé with tons of fruit flavours and a round finish.

fields.name: LÉGLI Villa Boclar 2015 EDITED
fields.description: The Léglis have been selecting the grapes for their traditional method sparkling base wine from the cool, tried and tested vineyard for years. In 2015, the Furmint and Riesling blend was put into the lean bottles, then the secondary fermentation was followed by long ageing. The bottles that have arrived now were disgorged after 37 months of ageing, and the mature traditional method sparkling wine is called Villa Boclar. The bubbles didn’t disappear during the long ageing, the wine only changed as the structure became layered, the palate creamy, and the mousse is now very nice.

fields.name: BALASSA Édes Szamorodni Bomboly 2017
fields.description: The lighter side of szamorodni: airy, floral and lively. That’s possibly why it required the least time in the 300-litre oak barrels and why it was the earliest to be ready. It comes from diverse soil, from light rhyolite tuff, quartz and andesite, which bring a real multitude of scintillation into the Bomboly. Mango, pineapple, fruit bomb aromas, youthful, easy to appreciate character.

fields.name: BALLA Sziklabor Feketeleányka 2017
fields.description: An indigenous Moldovan black grape variety from Géza Balla’s old-vine plantation that lies at 500 metres above sea level, spontaneously fermented and aged for 16 months in 225-litre barrels. The variety’s typical fruitiness, sour cherry, blackcurrant, blueberry, with soft, round tannins, and deep, intense and vibrant flavours.

fields.name: Rosé Cuvée 2019 Ménes
fields.description: Crispy and thick at the same time, with sweet fruits and fresh acidity. Géza Balla’s Ménes rosé nicely fuses the complexity of early-harvest and riper bunches.

fields.name: Bock Kadarka 2019
fields.description: A light red wine made from the produce of the Fekete-hegy vineyard, which after traditional fermentation is matured for six months as the third occupant of an oak barrel. It is characterized by a pale intensity; in its bouquet and taste can be discovered spices and aromas reminiscent of raspberry and strawberries.

fields.name: BOLYKI Rosé 2020
fields.description: Indicative blend: Kekfrankos and Merlot

fields.name: 12-month Red Wine Subscription
fields.description: Get 6 bottles of red wine each month for 12 months, all carefully selected by us from the best wineries and varieties of the region. Our best value offer!

fields.description: Get 6 bottles of white wine each month for 12 months, produced by the best wineries and carefully selected by us!

fields.name: Wine lucky dip!
fields.description:
Get  6 bottles of wine selected at random by us as a one-off!
Don't worry there's only winners in this game!

fields.name: Bolyki sauvignon Blanc 2020
fields.description: Aromatic and vivacious, this has notes of peach kernel and spice, and is a quirky weekday choice for Sauvignon Blanc fans who want to branch out and try something different. Made by first-generation winemaker János Bolyki who inherited a quarry from his father and decided to transform it into a winery. Gradually he acquired vineyards, and now produces a characterful range of wines, including this blend of Sauvignon Blanc with native Hungarian white grapes and Riesling makes up the remainder of the blend.

fields.name: BOTT FRIGYES Just Enjoy Red Cuvée 2019
fields.description: The natural version of Bott’s refined, Burgundy-style reds with the fresh fruit notes of whole-bunch fermentation, bitable, juicy flavours, fresh acidity and a light palate. A real ‘table red’ with the richness in detail of big reds.

fields.name: CSANÁDI Sauvignon Blanc 2020
fields.description: A pleasant Sauvignon Blanc with Intense and very fresh aromas on the nose, mainly green apple, kiwi along with citrus and mango on the nose. Medium+ acidity, slight oily feeling on the palate. Refreshing flavors of mango, citrus fresh banana along with dill and green herbs on the palate. Finish is medium with vegetal notes along with dill and anise.

fields.name: DEMETER ZOLTÁN Rosé Brut
fields.description: The continuation of the first, that is last year’s lighter, fruitier rosé traditional method sparkling wine from the 2018 vintage. Pure fruit, lively, elegant, a real ‘one more glass’ type, with strawberry, cherry, delicious brioche, gentle minerality and very subtle bubbles. A classic, small-producer’s traditional method sparkler made completely in Tokaj by Zoltán Demeter, from a blend of Furmint (Újhegy and Kakas vineyards) and Cabernet Franc (Kakas vineyard, where this non-local variety grows on 700 square metres).

fields.name: DEMETER ZOLTÁN Anett 2018 (0,5 l),
fields.description: An astonishing szamorodni, or as it says on the cork: a főbor (main wine) made with the aszú’s sweetness, and the complexity of the botrytised bunches that were vinified together. It’s a twinkling, pristinely pure wine with the vibrant play of the residual sugar and the acidity of the ripe fruit. Apricot, grape, dried apricot and a huge smile on the face. A big wine.

fields.name: DÚZSI Rosé Cuvée 2020
fields.description: A fresh, lively wine with only a little CO2, lots of fruit, strawberry and raspberry. It’s flavoursome and jolly, with a touch of bitterness on the finish.

fields.name: ETYEKI KÚRIA Pinot Noir Válogatás 2016
fields.description: Delicate flower notes (rose, violet), raspberry and rosehip, a slightly spicier character, ripe fig and dried cranberries in the finish.

fields.name: Figula Rosé Cuvée 2020
fields.description: The winery’s fresh rosé is made from the deeper coloured Merlot and Kékfrankos varieties. Based on its appearance and structure, it’s a somewhat heavier rosé than the usual new wine category. Deep berry fruits, lively acidity and an exciting palate.

fields.name: Sáfrán Olaszrizling 2019
fields.description: The 2019 vintage hands an even more serious role to this popular variety. Owing to the early ripening, it made it into the cellar before the autumn rains, and this way, from the excellent raw material, great wines could be made with steady hands. It’s an aromatically restrained, elegant, balanced and sophisticated version that reveals the wild white notes of the variety that can be discovered more in the Old Word wines, with their place-of-growth character. It’s a tank-made wine that retains the fresh fruit and the vibrant acidity.

fields.name: Gál Tibor Kadarka 2019
fields.description: Aromatic and elegant wine with earthy notes, mushroom and cherry.

fields.name: Gere Olaszrizling 2020
fields.description: Olaszrizling is not a typical variety in Villány, from where it comes with green apple, peach, floral and honey notes. A wine with good acidity and moderate alcohol.

fields.name: GERE Organic Portugieser 2019
fields.description: Portugieser is one of Villány’s most planted grape varieties. This grape has a long tradition in the region, and  produces easy-drinking, spicy, and somehow rustic reds, which are mostly consumed locally by the field workers. This Organic Selection Portugieser comes from four prestigious vineyards: Csillagvölgy, Fekete-hegy, Konkoly, and Ördögárok. This wine was fermented in stainless steel tanks, followed by four months of aging in used 5,000 liter oak casks. In the glass, this Portugieser has a beautiful opaque purple color. On the nose, it has flavors of juicy cherries, violets, sweet spices, and a hint of animality.

fields.name: GÜNZER Lezser 2020
fields.description: Interesting and complex wine. Acidity with a touch of minerality.

fields.name: GÜNZER Lezser Portugieser 2019
fields.description: Swabians brought this grape type, together with dedication and diligence, to Villány already at the beginning of the 1700’s. A vivid red Portugieser with fascinating violet aroma made from grapes harvested from three slopes (Bocor, Csillag- völgy and Jammertal).\r\n\r\nThis vin de primeur made in Beaujolais-style with great care and whole grape fermentation is truly full of fruits: each sip is full of plums, blackberries and cranberries. Beautiful, clear, mild with the characteristics typical for this vine variety. Don’t shelve it for too long.

fields.name: HOMONNA Rány Furmint 2018
fields.description: Rich, textured Furmint. Brioche, white and yellow peaches, lightly cooked apples, candied lemon peel, nutmeg, long finish. Fantastic, balanced wine.

fields.name: IKON Tulipán 2017
fields.description: The Syrah that had been the main component of the iconic Tulipán during earlier vintages is not part of the blend from this vintage onwards. After the first 2008 vintage, the winery reverted to the classic Bordeaux blend. The most beautiful grapes – half of it is from Merlot, plus Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Cabernet Franc – selected from a plot on the top of Diós, behind the winery. Following the 28 days of skin contact, it spent a bit more than a year in 225-litre Hungarian oak barrels, out of which one-third were new. The outcome is a wine that has a posture and character. It’s a vibrant, subtly tannic wine with elegant flavours, black berry fruits and a touch of chocolate and cigar.

fields.name: GYÖRGYKOVÁCS Nagy-Somlói Tramini 2017
fields.description: It’s an aroma bomb but there are no intrusive notes in it; classic rose water and honey. Lovely, long and thirst-quenching on the palate. The mineral place of growth and the barrel nicely come through.

fields.name: JÁSDI Rosé Cuvée 2020
fields.description: The usual kékfrankos-merlot blend. One brings freshness, the other is responsible for sophisticated scents. In sunset, drinking it from a humid glass under the big walnut tree with a pretty woman (or boy).

fields.name: Jasdi Pinot Gris 2020
fields.description: The first Jásdi wine from 2020 with the St Martin’s Day geese, which look like the well-known wild geese of Nils Holgersson, on the label. It has a dry, substantial palate with apple and peach, accompanied by a touch of minerality. It gives a lot more than a new wine.

fields.name: KALÁKA Báthori Cuvée (Hárslevelű-Furmint) 2018
fields.description: A huge wine. It’s layered in the same way as its fermentation happened – it was made from several small harvests with the musts piled on top of each other. Amazing purity and richness, with the minerality of the place of growth in Tállya. Vibrant and expansive with high acidity.

fields.name: KÁRÁSZTELEK Carassia Classic Brut 2017
fields.description: A traditional method sparkling wine that’s a blend of 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Noir, which spent 22 months on lees, with 6g/l dosage.\r\n\r\nA shiny pale-yellow colour, with apricot, green pear and citrus fruit on the nose, mixed with the aromas of fresh bread from the ageing on lees. Fruity and yeasty notes on the palate, lemon oil, apricot, brioche and yeast. A very long, creamy mousse, with fresh acidity.

fields.name: KISS GÁBOR 364 Rosé 2020
fields.description: A young, crispy rose with a lot of fruit and aromas, perfect for a romantic dinner!

fields.name: KONYÁRI Fecske Vörös 2019
fields.description: Dani Konyári’s medium-bodied, ‘bistro’ red, made from the two Cabernet varieties with a touch of Syrah. Its youthful colour is purplish and full of life, with fresh fruits on the nose, then a light structure. The palate and its weight are spot on, with the lighter fruity notes alongside the touch of oak and round flavours.

fields.name: Kreinbacher Prestige Brut
fields.description: Lime, flowers, sweetbread and stone-fruit on the nose. Well-structured, balanced and fresh. A soft and gentle blend with tiny bubbles, grapefruit and mineral saltiness on the long finish.

fields.name: KREINBACHER Nagy-Somlói Juhfark 2019
fields.description: Attractive nose with citrus, sweet pear aromas and mineral tones characteristic of the Somló terroir, youthful but complex at the same time. Herbs and spice on the palate, with refreshing acidity amplifying the flavours of citrus fruits and a hint saltiness. Long mineral finish, soft and rounded mouthfeel.

fields.name: LAPOSA Rosé 2020
fields.description: Lots of fruit: strawberry, raspberry and wild strawberry. Long finish, pronounced acids and vibrant flavours.

fields.name: LAPOSA Hableány Brut 2019
fields.description: A Furmint-based sparkling wine made via the Charmat (tank) method, blended with a touch of Olaszrizling, from the Laposa family’s newly-built cellar, from the foot of Badacsony Hill. Shiny yellow colour with greenish tints and tonnes of tiny bubbles. Green apple, lime, citrus fruit, a waxy-minty character, with minerality also appearing with time. Really delicious acidity, dry palate, refreshing feel, millions of tiny bubbles. Apple and pomelo on the palate, lime and slightly salty minerality on the very long finish. After a few minutes and a few sips – quince and medlar notes, reminiscent of Furmint, also appear.

fields.name: LAPOSA Szürkebarát 2020
fields.description: They say that after France Pinot Gris found his second home in Badacsony. This one provides the best of two worlds: well-known softness and elegance. The aroma of the 2020 vintage evokes white flowers, a delicate spiciness, but in its flavor it shows a full, complex wine.A real princess that is worth all efforts and can make even a Monday evening special.

fields.name: LÉGLI Blanc 2020
fields.description: In accordance with the vintage, it’s a rich and exciting blend from Ottó Légli’s family winery in Balatonboglár. A vivacious Sauvignon Blanc with pure aromas, fresh green herbs, grape flower and green apple. The palate is also exciting and long, with the taut acidity and lively flavours of Sauvignon Blanc also playing an important role.

fields.name: LUKA Kékfrankos 2019
fields.description: After a short break, the Kékfrankos of Enikő Luka is available once again. Half a hectare of the 3.5-hectare ‘estate’ is Kékfrankos in the Spern Steiner vineyard. That’s where they harvested a small amount of bunches that were spontaneously fermented after destemming, and rounded out in used barrels. As per usual, it’s become warm, thick and spicy with good drinkability. It’s the face of Kékfrankos that’s easy to love.

fields.name: MÁRKVÁRT Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
fields.description: Subtly oaky, sour cherry, spicy aromas, then a juicy, pleasantly rustic palate, with the used large barrels’ and the variety’s exciting tannins. A taut, lovable, long wine from a tiny cellar, where every move from the grapes to bottling is the work of the Márkvárt family.

fields.name: PÁLFFY Káli Rajnai Rizling 2019
fields.description: One of the winery's favourite wines, riesling is a light-skinned, aromatic grape of German origin which is – if the majority of top wine critics are to be believed – the world's finest white wine grape variety.

fields.name: Pannonhalmi St. Martinus 2020
fields.description: The Királyleányka and Gewürtztraminer (Fűszeres Tramini) grapes of the south- to southwest-facing Széldomb and Packalló vineyards blended in a half-half proportion. Grapefruit, pomelo, white flowers, feel-good acidity. It has a broad, flavoursome, long, substantial palate and 4 grams of residual sugar that makes it even rounder.

fields.name: ROYAL TOKAJI Late Harvest Cuvée 2017
fields.description: This wine's sweetness is achieved by allowing the grapes extended ripening time on the vine. Pale green-gold colour. The nose is more delicate than many a Tokaji, with aromas of ripe peach, exotic fruit and blossom. Moderate palate weight, with a fine balance of intense sweetness and acidic lift.

fields.name: Ruppert Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
fields.description: Cabernet Sauvignon is rarely – only in the best vintages – made as a separate wine at the cellar. Usually, it’s the Merlot and the Franc that do better on the hill, hence that’s why we associate these two varieties with the Rupperts. In 2017, however, out of the two Cabernet Sauvignon plots, the lower location with the better water supply yielded the best fruit at the end of the harvest, better than what the Franc or Merlot could give at the time. That’s how after a five-year long hiatus, the pure Sauvignon was made for the first time since 2012. Its palate is even broader than the Franc’s, with less spice, more oak and dark fruit notes. It’s a ripe, rich wine for long tables and big dinners. It was fermented on the skins in tanks, then most of it was put into new barrels where it was aged for a year and a half.

fields.name: Sauska Merlot Konkoly 2016",
fields.description: Lively ruby red. Rich floral aromas along with some spices, tobacco, cacao, and black currant. At first crispy, jumpy, and vibrant on the palate, showcasing great complexity, depth, and finesse as time goes on. Please decant if you can.

fields.name: Sauska Siller 2020
fields.description: Elegant ruby with an intense nose of forest berries, cherry and freshly-cut vines. The palate is fresh and tart with current and blackthorn. An earthy and pretty wine just like the Villány locals like it: simple and tight, borderline red but luckily not.Varietal composition:cabernet sauvignon,merlot,kékfrankos,pinot noir,portugieser,kadarka

fields.name: PÁLFFY Pinot Noir Brut Fehér Methode Traditionelle 2017
fields.description: A small-producer brut made by the traditional method from the Köveskál vine-dresser family’s Mál plots. 100% Pinot Noir, ripe fruit nose, apple and black cherry on the slowly unfolding palate, with subtle bubbles, mushroom, forest floor and a long finish.

fields.name: SAUSKA TOKAJ 6 puttonyos Aszú 2017
fields.description: Picked from 30-35-year old Sárgamuskotály, Furmint and Hárslevelű vines, from the Medve, the Úrágya and the Birsalmás vineyards. The botrytised ‘aszú’ berries were hand harvested one-by-one, selected, then macerated in the fermenting must for 24 hours. After gentle pressing, it was aged in barrels for 20 months. A healthy, pure botrytis nose, alongside the dried apricot and saffron aromas. The vibrant acids are in perfect harmony with the 228 g/l of residual sugar.

fields.name: Sauska Tokaj extra brut
fields.description: Citrus yellow gold with a regular stream of bubbles. Alluring on the nose, intense, with notes of juicy peaches, apricot and honey. Beautiful aromatic complexity. A great presence in the mouth, with structure, intensity and an elegant acidity. Ripe citrus and tropical fruits, with a touch of tobacco and honey.

fields.name: SAUSKA Extra Brut Rosé
fields.description: A brilliant salmon with copper hues, and discreet bubbles. Scrumptious on the nose, with raspberries, blood orange and a touch of demerara sugar, and its warm spices. Good length, slowly unveiling orange and spices such as pepper and nutmeg. Stewed plums upheld by a crisp minerality.

fields.name: Skizo Rosé 2020
fields.description: A purplish-pink coloured rosé with aromas that are reminiscent of the forest, with sour cherry, cherry and redcurrant on the lean, dry palate.
